author: Gianmarco Sotelo, AFP
title: San Marino gan√≥ luego de m√°s de 20 a√±os, 1-0 contra Liechtenstein: vea ac√° el gol de Nicko Sensoli - GolCaracol
text: ¬°Hist√≥rico, un d√≠a para no olvidar en San Marino! El seleccionado europeo venci√≥ 1-0 a Liechtenstein, este jueves 5 de septiembre de 2024, y luego de 20 a√±os volvi√≥ a conseguir una victoria. El √∫nico gol del partido fue de Nicko Sensoli, al minuto 53 en el estadio Ol√≠mpico de San Marino, luego de dos errores en defensa del combinado rival. ¬øCu√°ntos a√±os estuvo San Marino sin conseguir una victoria? En el diario ‚ÄòClar√≠n‚Äô explicaron exactamente que ‚Äúfueron 20 a√±os y cinco meses en los que acumul√≥ seis empates y 135 derrotas, con apenas 21 goles a favor y 568 en contra‚Äù. El duelo de este jueves entre San Marino y Liechtenstein se dio por la fecha 1 del grupo M de las Nations League. Publicidad As√≠ fue el gol de Nicko Sensoli, para el hist√≥rico triunfo de San Marino 1-0 contra Liechtenstein, luego de 20 a√±os sin ganar: ¬°¬°ATENCI√ìN!! ¬°¬°HAY GOL DE SAN MARINO!! Blooper y definici√≥n de Nicko Sensoli para el 1-0 ante Liechtenstein, en una jornada que puede ser hist√≥rica...‚Äî SportsCenter (@SC_ESPN) üì∫ Mir√° la [#NationsLeague]en [#DisneyPlus]Premium [pic.twitter.com/uaqcR8wFNn] [September 5, 2024] Publicidad "SAN MARINO 1, LIECHTENSTEIN 0. SAN MARINO 1, LIECHTENSTEIN 0..."‚Äî SportsCenter (@SC_ESPN) üá∏üá≤ Locura total de la voz del estadio y de la gente tras la primera victoria de San Marino EN 20 A√ëOS... üì∫ Mir√° la [#NationsLeague]en [#DisneyPlus] [pic.twitter.com/U8IPK76CDt] [September 5, 2024] San Marino, el peor equipo del mundo seg√∫n la clasificaci√≥n de la FIFA, hizo historia el jueves al vencer a Liechtenstein por 1-0 en la Liga de Naciones de la UEFA para conseguir su primera victoria competitiva. El peque√±o pa√≠s de apenas 30.000 habitantes, rodeado por Italia, lleg√≥ al partido en el estadio de San Marino buscando su primera victoria de cualquier tipo desde que venci√≥ a Liechtenstein en un amistoso en 2004. A Liechtenstein le anularon un gol por un ajustado fuera de juego en la primera mitad antes de que San Marino aprovechara un error defensivo para anotar el gol de la victoria en el minuto 53 gracias a Nicko Sensoli. Publicidad Ten√≠a 19 a√±os y no hab√≠a nacido cuando el equipo que ocupa el puesto 210 y √∫ltimo en la clasificaci√≥n mundial gan√≥ un partido por √∫ltima vez. Los chivos expiatorios del f√∫tbol internacional se hab√≠an ido preparando para lograrlo, habiendo empatado en partidos amistosos contra Seychelles, Santa Luc√≠a y Saint Kitts y Nevis en los √∫ltimos dos a√±os. Est√°n en el Grupo 1 de tres equipos de la Liga D de la √∫ltima divisi√≥n de la Liga de Naciones, siendo Gibraltar su otro oponente. author: Sleep Review Staff
title: Narcolepsy Insights from Alkermes Presented at Psych Congress and NEI Congress
text:
Alkermes‚Äô presentations feature research on its investigational treatment ALKS 2680 for narcolepsy and insights on the burden of living with the condition. Summary: Alkermes presented new research on its investigational narcolepsy treatment, ALKS 2680, as well as findings on the patient experience of narcolepsy at two scientific conferences: the 37th Annual Psych Congress and the 2024 Neuroscience Education Institute Congress. The data includes safety and efficacy results from a phase 1b study of ALKS 2680, a selective orexin 2 receptor agonist for narcolepsy types 1 and 2, alongside qualitative insights into the clinical and humanistic burden of living with narcolepsy.
Key Takeaways:
Investigational Narcolepsy Treatment : Alkermes shared safety and efficacy data on ALKS 2680, a selective orexin 2 receptor agonist, for treating narcolepsy types 1 and 2. Patient-Centered Research : Qualitative interviews and literature reviews revealed insights into the clinical, economic, and personal burdens associated with narcolepsy. Cross-Disorder Focus : Alkermes‚Äô research presentations at major conferences also included data on treatments and patient experiences for schizophrenia and bipolar I disorder. Alkermes plc announced the presentation of research related to its research in narcolepsy, as well as schizophrenia and bipolar I disorder, at two scientific conferences this fall.
The two meetings are the 37th Annual Psych Congress (Psych Congress), which took place Oct 29 to Nov 2 in Boston, and the 2024 Neuroscience Education Institute Congress, taking place Nov 7-10 in Colorado Springs, Colorado.
‚ÄúThe wealth of data being presented at these important medical gatherings underscores the substantive research being conducted at Alkermes to understand the experiences of people taking our commercial and investigational medicines, as well as advance knowledge about the complex disease states in which we work,‚Äù says Craig Hopkinson, MD, chief medical officer and executive vice president of research and development at Alkermes, in a release. ‚ÄúWe are excited to share our insights with stakeholders from across the psychiatric and neuroscience communities and engage in valuable scientific exchange to help advance care for patients living with schizophrenia, bipolar I disorder, and narcolepsy.‚Äù
Alkermes is developing ALKS 2680, an investigational medicine in development as a once-daily treatment for narcolepsy and idiopathic hypersomnia.
Aklermes presented multiple posters related to the company‚Äôs work in narcolepsy, including:
Safety and efficacy data from the proof-of-concept phase 1b study of ALKS 2680, the company‚Äôs novel, investigational, oral, selective orexin 2 receptor (OX2R) agonist, in patients with narcolepsy type 1 and narcolepsy type 2 ; and Research from in-depth, qualitative interviews and systematic literature reviews designed to better understand the clinical, economic, and humanistic burden associated with narcolepsy. The list of Alkermes‚Äô presentations in narcolepsy by meeting is as follows:
Psych Congress
Poster #23: Safety and Pharmacodynamic Effects of the Orexin 2 Receptor Agonist ALKS 2680 in Patients With Narcolepsy Type 1: A First-in-Human Phase 1 Study Poster #125: The Burden of Living With Narcolepsy: Patient Perspectives From In-Depth Qualitative Interviews Poster #126: Clinical, Economic, and Humanistic Burden Associated With Narcolepsy: Results From a Systematic Literature Review Poster #170: The Orexin 2 Receptor Agonist ALKS 2680 in Patients With Narcolepsy Type 2: An Initial Proof of Concept Phase 1b Study 2024 Neuroscience Education Institute Congress
Poster 73: The Burden of Living With Narcolepsy: Patient Perspectives from In-Depth Qualitative Interviews Poster 74: Clinical, Economic, and Humanistic Burden Associated With Narcolepsy: Results From a Systematic Literature Review ID 68691723 ¬© Kiosea39 | Dreamstime.com
Further Reading for You: How to Select the Most Suitable Pharmacotherapy for Type 1 Narcolepsy Patients Once-Nightly Lumryz Attracts Over 1,200 Narcolepsy Patients Since June Launch Health Canada Approves Wakix for Pediatric Narcolepsy Patients Orexin-2 Receptor Agonist E2086 to Be Tested in Narcolepsy Patients Narcolepsy Patients Prefer Once-Nightly Lumryz Over Twice-Nightly Oxybate

author: Juhi Sharma
title: Anant Ambani's Pet Dog, Happy Passed Away, Family Pays Tribute With An Emotional Note, 'Live On...'
text:
Mukesh and Nita Ambani's younger son, Anant Ambani, is a huge animal lover. He recently inaugurated the Vantara animal conservation and rehabilitation centre in Jamnagar, Gujarat. The businessman also had a great companion at home, who he deeply loved. Anant Ambani's pet dog, Happy, passed away
Anant Ambani's fur baby, Happy, is no longer with us. The dog was deeply loved by all his family members, especially Anant. It was Viral Bhayani's Instagram handle that first shared the saddening news of Happy's demise. The post revealed that Happy passed away on April 30, 2025, and revealed that the family had paid their heartfelt tribute to the dog, who was considered one of the most loved members of their family. ADVT.
ADVT.
TRENDING NOW The Ambani family's heartfelt tribute to Happy
It was actor, Veer Pahariya who shared some glimpses from the emotional tribute. He shared a picture of a beautifully decorated memorial created by the Ambani family in loving memory of Happy. The first image features a long note by the family sharing how much they loved and adored their pet dog and how saddened they are by Happy's passing.
The Ambani family, with heavy hearts, shared the news of the passing of their pet dog, Happy. They revealed that he was more than just a dog to them; he was like a family member, whose presence gave them constant, unconditional love and comfort. The note further shared that the happiness their fur baby provided would never be forgotten, and he would continue to live on in their hearts. The note was quoted as saying:
"In the loving memory of beloved Happy. It is with heavy heart that we share the sad news of the passing of our beloved dog, Happy. More than just a pet, he was family- a loyal companion, a source of comfort, and a constant presence of unconditional love. The joy HAPPY brought into our lives will never be forgotten. From the playful moments to the quiet times of companionship, His memory will forever live in our hearts. Run free, sweet Happy. You will be deeply missed, always loved and never forgotten."
ADVT.
The picture also featured another poster with an adorable picture of Happy. The poster further expressed the family's sadness. The Ambani family referred to the passing of their beloved Happy as a loss. Veer Pahariya also shared a picture with Happy in his bed. The note was quoted as saying: advertisement.
Continue reading below
YOU MAY ALSO LIKE Virat Kohli And Anushka Sharma Allegedly Drink This Imported Brand's Water, Here's How Much It Costs Published: May 1, 2025 | 10:38:52 IST Palak Tiwari's Rumoured BF, Ibrahim Ali Khan Meets Her Brother, Reyansh Kohli At Her Movie Screening Published: May 1, 2025 | 01:56:50 IST Anant Ambani's Wife, Radhika Merchant On His 'Padayatra' To Dwarkadhish: 'Shaadi Ke Baad...' Published: Apr 6, 2025 | 12:02:06 IST Anant Ambani Completes 170 Km Padayatra From Jamnagar To Dwarkadish Temple, Nita, Radhika Accompany Published: Apr 6, 2025 | 12:01:44 IST "Dear Happy, You will forever be a part of us and live on in our hearts. Heaven's gain is our loss."
Anant Ambani's Happy owned a Mercedes-Benz G400d luxury SUV
Happy lived a luxurious life, just like the other members of the Ambani family . He was provided with all the amenities and comfort, including a personal car for travelling. The Ambani family's beloved pet, a golden retriever named Happy, travelled in a Mercedes-Benz G400d luxury SUV, priced at Rs 2.55 to Rs. 3 crore in India. While the family's security convoy features several prestigious G63 AMG SUVs, the G400d stands out as a distinctive diesel variant which was exclusively for Happy. ADVT.
Team BollywoodShaadis extend our heartfelt condolences on the passing of Happy.

author: Adam Lichtenstein
title: Hurricanes end year with Pinstripe Bowl loss to Rutgers
text:
NEW YORK CITY ‚Äî The Hurricanes‚Äô run defense was stout for nearly the entire season, but with several players missing due to the NFL draft or departing via the transfer portal, the run defense faltered.
Rutgers racked up 208 yards on the ground and scored three rushing touchdowns as the Scarlet Knights (7-6) picked up a 31-24 win over Miami (7-6) in the Pinstripe Bowl at Yankee Stadium. The Hurricanes have now lost their last five bowl appearances and 11 of their past 12.
‚ÄúWe look at it with honesty, we look at it with reality: There‚Äôs so many good things that we have done throughout the season that show progress, and yet we find ourselves showing a lack of discipline in crunch time,‚Äù Miami coach Mario Cristobal said. ‚ÄúA special teams blunder and a turnover on downs is a turnover. So those are things that you have to just attack collectively, as a group, as an organization. Coaches, players, everybody. There‚Äôs no pointing fingers in there. When you win, you win together. When you lose, you lose together.‚Äù
Miami entered the game missing several key players. Starting quarterback Tyler Van Dyke and wide receiver Colbie Young transferred to Wisconsin and Georgia, respectively. Starting defensive tackle Leonard Taylor III, starting safeties Kam Kinchens and James Williams and starting offensive linemen Javion Cohen and Matt Lee all sat the game out as they prepared for the NFL draft.
The Hurricanes got off to a sluggish start on defense. Rutgers went up 14-0 to start the game, getting touchdowns on a goal-line run by quarterback Gavin Wimsatt and a 7-yard run by Kyle Monangai.
Miami‚Äôs offense got out to a slow start, managing just 5 yards in the first quarter. But the Scarlet Knights aided the Hurricanes late in the first half, committing a pair of personal fouls to help UM get in the red zone. Jacurri Brown put the Hurricanes on the board with a 7-yard run and score, sliding into the end zone.
The Hurricanes got the ball back at their own 10-yard line with 40 seconds left, but instead of taking a knee to end the half down a score, they chose to try for points. The decision paid off, as they drove down the field and reached the Scarlet Knights‚Äô 17-yard line. Miami nearly scored a game-tying touchdown on a catch by Xavier Restrepo, but a review ruled him out of bounds. The Hurricanes needed to settle for a field goal to end the second quarter.
Miami jumped out to its one lead of the game on a 30-yard touchdown from Brown to Restrepo on their first drive of the second half, but their second ended in disaster. After the Scarlet Knights pinned the Hurricanes inside the 10 on a punt, they forced a three-and-out.
Rutgers‚Äô Trevor Kodie-Yeboah blocked a Dylan Joyce punt in the end zone, and Timmy Ward recovered it for a Scarlet Knights go-ahead touchdown.
‚ÄúObviously, a block and a touchdown at the same time is massive in terms of momentum,‚Äù Cristobal said.
Rutgers put the game away in the fourth quarter. Monangai, who finished the game with 163 yards, broke off a 40-yard run to put Rutgers at the Miami 1. Wimsatt punched in another 1-yard score to put the Scarlet Knights up by 11.
‚ÄúThat was a really good running back,‚Äù Mauigoa said. ‚Äú‚Ä¶ We just didn‚Äôt fit our gaps and (missed) assignments, and that‚Äôs something we‚Äôve got to work on.‚Äù
Brown added a late rushing touchdown, and Miami recovered an onside kick to create some late drama, but the Hurricanes could not mount a game-tying drive.
Five takeaways Offense flashes for moments with Jacurri Brown Brown played his first snaps of the season, and on some drives, that was obvious. Miami‚Äôs offense had four three-and-outs (one of which resulted in a blocked punt and touchdown) and was forced to punt four times. Brown also threw a brutal interception in the first half that led to a Scarlet Knights touchdown.
But Brown was efficient on some drives, leading UM down the field before the end of the first half and on their first drive of the second half. He threw several well-executed passes, including a touchdown to Restrepo and another near-touchdown that was overturned on review.
Brown ended the game 20 of 31 for 181 yards, one touchdown and one interception. He also ran for a team-best 57 yards and scored a pair of touchdowns.
‚ÄúI thought he played hard and did a lot of really good things,‚Äù Cristobal said. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôd love to have that one interception back. ‚Ä¶ But he really made some explosive plays. He found his way out of the pocket when the pocket collapsed a little bit. Made some really good throws, some others he‚Äôd like to have back against a team that‚Äôs a top-10 defense in the passing game.‚Äù
Xavier Restrepo hits 1,000 yards The Hurricanes‚Äô veteran wide receiver could leave Miami and enter the NFL draft if he wants. If that is Restrepo‚Äôs choice, his final game at Miami was a stellar one.
Restrepo made several good catches against Rutgers and nearly pulled off a touchdown catch from the seat of his pants. He ended the game with 99 yards, putting him at 1,092 yards for the season ‚Äîtied with Andre Johnson for the fifth-most in UM history. He had 11 receptions, giving him 85 for the season ‚Äî the most catches for a Hurricanes receiver in a single year.
‚ÄúObviously, Restrepo‚Äôs done a really good job all year,‚Äù Cristobal said. ‚ÄúMade some big catches today, as well. ‚Ä¶ Always plays hard, always throws his body around and is a very reliable and explosive player.‚Äù
Defense makes adjustments Miami‚Äôs defense struggled to stop Rutgers‚Äô offensive attack early in the game, surrendering 153 yards on the Scarlet Knights‚Äô first three drives.
But the Hurricanes bounced back, forcing punts on the subsequent three drives before surrendering another rushing touchdown to Monangai.
Miami entered the game with the nation‚Äôs No. 10 rush defense but ultimately gave up 208 rushing yards, which was the second-most they have surrendered all year. The 292 total yards UM surrendered was the fifth-best game, by yardage, for the Hurricanes‚Äô defense this season.
Injuries to key players The worst-case scenario for a bowl game happened in the first quarter. Hurricanes star running back Mark Fletcher Jr. suffered a foot injury on a carry and had to be helped off the field. He was taken from the sideline in a cart and did not return to the game.
Cristobal said X-rays on Fletcher‚Äôs foot were negative but there was ‚Äúcertainly something else going on there.‚Äù
Fletcher, an American Heritage alum, has grown into a dependable running back for the Hurricanes in his first season. He ran for 514 yards and five touchdowns as a freshman.
In the fourth quarter, sophomore linebacker Wesley Bissainthe also suffered an upper-body injury, Cristobal said, and did not return to the game.
Rueben Bain ends freshman year on high note Freshman defensive lineman Rueben Bain Jr. has blossomed into a star in his freshman season, and his final game of the year showed why.
The explosive defensive end racked up seven tackles with three tackles for loss, a career-high, and a forced fumble in the loss.
‚ÄúIt means the world to him,‚Äù Cristobal said. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs what it is. He‚Äôs really talented, but he plays really, really hard, and it means the world to him. We need a bunch more guys like Rueben.‚Äù

author: @francophileenoz
title: Queensland Women Drown in Gympie Stormwater Drain | Illawarra Mercury | Wollongong, NSW
text: Two Queensland women who drowned in a stormwater drain following wild weather conditions have been identified as 46-year-old Tanya Hehir and 40-year-old Helen Bradford. The women were exploring a 2.4km drain called the "love tunnel" in Gympie with a friend when they were swept away by floodwaters. Their companion, a 46-year-old woman made it to safety and contacted police. Emergency services were called to the Kidd Bridge around 3.20pm. A search and rescue operation commenced involving water police, general duties officers, swift water rescue crews and the SES. Police first recovered Helen Bradford's body at 7:10pm on Boxing Day and Tanya Hehir's body on December 27. Tanya Hehir was a keen runner and a member of the Gympie Hash House Harriers. Gympie Regional Council mayor Glen Hartwig told the ABC that he would consider new safety measures in light of the tragedy. "It's an old stormwater system that's been there since the foundation of Gympie," he said. "It's not a place to be played with. It's not a place where you want to go and explore." Acting superintendent Paul Algie said in recent times that weather events were developing quickly and advised the public to be careful near water. "There is always the chance tragedy can strike," he said. Sign up for our newsletter to stay up to date. We care about the protection of your data. Read our [Privacy Policy](/privacy/).

author: ÊòüÊ¥≤ÁΩë
title: Ngeh‚Äôs proposal to have non-Muslim experts in syariah law committee a mistake: Loke - News
text: KUALA LUMPUR: DAP secretary-general Anthony Loke today stressed that the proposal by Beruas Member of Parliament Datuk Ngeh Koo Ham for the government to appoint non-Muslim legal experts into the special committee to study issues related to the competencies of state legislative assembly in enacting Islamic laws was a mistake and misunderstanding about the committee‚Äôs source of power. Realising that the proposal could spark controversy as DAP would be seen trying to meddle in Islamic legal affairs, Loke asserted that this is entirely untrue because the party is committed to the principle of mutual respect and harmony among religions and ethnicities. ‚ÄúThe committee was established by the Malaysian National Council for Islamic Religious Affairs (MKI), chaired by Sultan Sharafuddin Idris Shah of Selangor, and aims to advise the council with suggestions to empower and elevate the jurisdictions of Syariah Courts. ‚ÄúIt should be emphasised that the establishment of this special committee is not determined by the cabinet but by MKI, and they report directly to MKI. ‚ÄúDAP respects the wisdom of His Royal Highness the Sultan of Selangor in making any decisions regarding MKI affairs,‚Äù he said in a statement today. Loke said any proposals by the special committee involving legal amendments must be brought to the Cabinet for the usual process of legal enactments. As such, Loke said non-Muslim communities need not worry about this matter because any legal amendments involving the rights of non-Muslims must be thoroughly discussed and finalised by the cabinet before being brought to Parliament. Yesterday, the media reported that Ngeh proposed the government appoint experts from the non-Muslim community to assist the special committee established earlier this month and to ensure that the non-Muslims‚Äô views were considered before making any changes to the laws. The proposal, however, was slammed by Umno secretary-general Datuk Dr. Asyraf Wajdi Dusuki, who said that there was no need for non-Muslim experts to be appointed to the special committee. Meanwhile, Bangi Member of Parliament Syahredzan Johan through a post of X today echoed Asyraf Wajdi‚Äôs sentiments, saying that he believed that the members of the special committee are experienced and competent in their respective fields, especially constitutional law, and would be able to conduct an objective study, going beyond considerations of their own ethnicity and religion. ‚ÄúFurthermore, the committee‚Äôs suggestions or findings are not binding on the cabinet, and I believe that all views and further engagement sessions will be conducted before any suggestions are accepted and implemented. ‚ÄúTherefore, there is no reason to say that the views or suggestions presented to the government will be limited to one party,‚Äù he said, adding that all parties should give space to the committee to continue what has been entrusted to them to start addressing the issues that need to be fully resolved. ADVERTISEMENT ADVERTISEMENT

author: laprovence.com
title: "En plein air pour la mer" : l'op√©ration de ramassage de d√©chets pour prot√©ger les plages de La Ciotat
text:
"En plein air pour la mer" : l'op√©ration de ramassage de d√©chets pour prot√©ger les plages de La Ciotat Par La Provence
Publi√© le 05/07/24 √† 13:10 - Mis √† jour le 05/07/24 √† 13:10
Op√©ration ramassage de d√©chets sur les plages Cyrnos et Lumi√®re samedi matin.
Photo i.M.
La Ciotat L'Atelier Bleu et le Casino Plein Air de La Ciotat proposent pour la premi√®re fois une grande journ√©e festive de sensibilisation √† la protection des plages et du littoral appel√©e "En plein air pour la mer". Elle se tiendra samedi 6 juillet en bord de mer sur l'esplanade Langlois de La Ciotat. Ouverte √† tous, la journ√©e de samedi d√©butera √† 10 heures par un ramassage de d√©chets sur les plages Cyrnos et Lumi√®re. L'action commencera sportivement par un √©chauffement des participants qui, une fois bien en forme, partiront nettoyer les plages jusqu'√† 12 heures 30, moment de la remise des prix. Ce sera l'occasion de f√©liciter les gagnants des d√©fis propos√©s comme la collecte d'un d√©chet insolite ou le challenge de ramasser le plus grand nombre de m√©gots... Une collation sera ensuite offerte √† tous les participants.
Un village durable Tout au long de la journ√©e, le public pourra explorer le village durable install√© sur l'esplanade. C'est l√† que seront les partenaires de l'Atelier Bleu comme le Parc national des Calanques et les associations qui travaillent pour l'environnement: Z√©ro Waste Marseille , Wings of the Ocean, 1 d√©chet par jour, MerTerre, l'ADEE et Recyclop. Tous sensibiliseront petits et grands aux enjeux du milieu marin et aux impacts des d√©chets en proposant des jeux.
√Ä lire aussi : Cette association de voitures anciennes organise une vir√©e en pleine nature au d√©part de La Ciotat L'apr√®s-midi sera rythm√©e par diverses animations et d√©fis qui raviront certainement les participants de tous √¢ges. Il y aura un stand de maquillage de la mer, la possibilit√© de cr√©er une fresque collaborative g√©ante... La journ√©e se terminera en musique √† 18 heures avec plusieurs concerts qui donneront une touche musicale et festive √† cet √©v√©nement engag√© pour la pr√©servation de la mer et de notre plan√®te.
Samedi 6 juillet d√®s 10 h. Plus d'infos aupr√®s de l'association ciotadenne d'√©ducation √† l'environnement l'Atelier Bleu au 04 42 08 07 67.

author: J. Peterson
title: Christina Aguilera shocks fans with skinny frame and 'unrecognizable' appearance amid Ozempic rumors
text:
Christina Aguilera has shocked her longtime fans after appearing completely unrecognisable in a new photoshoot for Carcy magazine. Christina Aguilera has shocked her longtime fans after appearing completely unrecognizable in a new photoshoot.
The 44-year-old, who has been rumored to have used Ozempic, covered Carcy magazine with a new look following her drastic weight loss.
In one image, the Beautiful singer sat cross legged in a chair while wearing a flimsy gold mini-dress.
Her blonde hair was tousled and she had smoky eye makeup on.
While the shoot drew a lot of praise, many initially failed to recognize that Christina was the subject.
'Why does she have a different face every time we see her?' asked one.
'HOW IS SHE BENJAMIN BUTTONING? I've always been such a huge Christina fan and it's been so nice to see her look so happy, healthy and THRIVING lately and this shoot is SO GORGEOUS,' gushed another.
A slender Christina Aguilera has shocked her longtime fans after appearing completely unrecognizable in a new photoshoot
The hitmaker showed off her fuller figure on the red carpet back in 2012
'I thought that was Nicola Peltz for a second,' added another.
A fourth speculated, 'Ozempic not only made her lose weight but changed her face too.'
Another wrote, 'Her ability to look younger every time I see her should be studied. She's literally aging backwards and looks so stunning.'
Although she has not directly responded to Ozempic rumors, Christina recently remarked that she no longer feels the need to 'give a f**k' about the public scrutiny on her body.
Speaking about her early years in the music industry, Christina told Glamour magazine that music bosses were unhappy when she gained weight in her 20s - and said they preferred her as a 'skinny‚Ä¶
J. Peterson

author: KRISTINA WATROBSKI | The National Desk
title: chevron-right
text: SYRACUSE, N.Y. (TND) ‚Äî The alleged murder of a woman in New York by an illegal immigrant is prompting Republican lawmakers to scrutinize the state's "sanctuary" policies. 21-year-old Jhon Moises Chacaguasay-Ilbis is accused of strangling Joselyn Toaquiza, a hotel housekeeper from Ecuador, to death this month. The woman's body was found in Syracuse's Lincoln Park on Saturday, three days after she was reported missing and just one day after her 21st birthday. Chacaguasay-Ilbis and Toaquiza were previously classmates while both living in Ecuador, family members told [CNY Central](https://cnycentral.com/news/local/syracuse-murder-arrest-joselyn-toaquiza-lincoln-park-strangulation-custody-onondaga-county-district-attorney#). Chacaguasay-Ilbis pled not guilty Thursday to charges of murder and concealment of a corpse, claiming he has no memory of the incident due to being under the influence of alcohol. He is currently being held without bail with a preliminary court hearing set for July 2. The man allegedly entered the U.S. illegally last year and may have been applying for asylum. It is not immediately clear what Toaquiza's immigration status was. However, the revelation surrounding Chacaguasay-Ilbis has prompted some Republican lawmakers to sound the alarm on state and federal immigration policies. The border crisis is no longer isolated in states like Texas; it‚Äôs in our own backyard. This coward should have never been let into our country in the first place, but open-border Democrats welcomed him with open arms," Assemblyman John Lemondes, R-District 126, told The National Desk (TND). "This is a direct result of former-Gov. Cuomo‚Äôs sanctuary state policies which have been continued by Gov. Hochul," the assemblyman continued. "Until we recognize this crisis for what it is, we will continue to see tragedies like this.
